ccStages.name: Barren Plaza
ccStages.description: A wide-open space in the middle of the slums, filled with haphazardly discarded garbage and vagrants with nowhere else to go. However, this place has also become a suitable den for enemies to hide.

ccStages.name: Abandoned High-rise
ccStages.description: This high-rise was abandoned after being destroyed by the flames of war, and was subsequently captured by the enemy. They now leverage the visibility it brings to defend their territory - we must recapture it.

ccStages.name: Area 59 Ruins
ccStages.description: This district within Chernobog was abandoned due to its small size and lack of strategic significance. It has since been occupied by wandering enemy forces, and we must recapture it to prevent enemies from slipping through our encirclement.

ccStages.name: Desolate Desert
ccStages.description: Located deep within a remote, uncharted desert, the barren but rugged terrain provides refuge for our enemies. It is necessary to stop them before they penetrate deeper into the wilderness.

ccStages.name: Broken Path
ccStages.description: Streets torn apart by war, the pavement turned inside out, walls torn down like paper ‚Äì and the culprits that caused all this destruction are still lurking nearby.

ccStages.name: New Street
ccStages.description: What was once one of Lungmen's most thriving streets is now little more than a testimony to how quickly it was deserted. Some enemies are still operating in this area, posing a threat to civilians nearby.

ccStages.name: Transport Hub
ccStages.description: Lungmen's crucial transport hub, as one of the most important strategic strongholds in the entire city, is now caught in a crossfire between multiple factions vying for control. Now, it is our job to take it back.

ccStages.name: Frost-Covered Ruins
ccStages.description: In the aftermath of a large battle where a large section of the ruins was frozen over roams remnants of the enemy, as well as berserk Originium-related creatures. Occasionally, one will see snowflakes dancing out-of-season.

ccStages.name: Pyrite Gorge
ccStages.description:
A gorge covered in yellow sand that gives off a metalic sheen in the sunlight. Proceed with caution, for plunderers often lurk where the sun does not reach.
<Stun Generator> Pay a cost to activate it, damaging and stunning nearby enemies.

ccStages.name: East Armory
ccStages.description: In the eastern part of the L.G.D.'s Armory, the battle over armaments has not yet ended. Please help restore stability to this area.

ccStages.name: Deserted Factory
ccStages.description: Reunion has occupied the deserted factories in Chernobog. The enemy has already set up their ambush, so please leverage the surrounding environment to your advantage.

ccStages.name: Windswept Highland
ccStages.description: These perenially windswept highlands, far away from the paths of any nomadic cities, are believed to harbor hostile enemy forces. Investigate the situation and repel the threat.

ccStages.name: Area 6 Ruins
ccStages.description: One of Chernobog's core districts, turned into a battlefield by its chaotic tug-of-war, is now occupied by the remnants of the Reunion Movement. They must be expelled before order can return.

ccStages.name: Abandoned Mine
ccStages.description:
This abandoned mine far from the city has become a den of outlaws. Hurry up and clear them out to restore order to the area.
Rubble changes the enemy's route.

ccStages.name: Locked-Down Prison
ccStages.description:
A Columbian prison equipped with imprisonment devices. Help the jailers calm things down.
<Imprisonment Device> Imprisons freed enemies within its effect area.

ccStages.name: Arena 8
ccStages.description: Rhodes Island has been invited to participate in a sparring competition against Kazimierz knights. Please make full use of the venue to seize ultimate victory.

ccStages.name: Howling Desert
ccStages.description:
On the desolate plains where sandstorms reign supreme, locals and mercenaries alike fall together in a deadly clash, each seeking to usurp the other's wealth. It's time to correct such thinking.
<Sandstorm> Allied units caught inside the sandstorm will have reduced ATK, continuously take damage over time, and have extended redeployment time; Enemy units will instead be slowed
<Dirt Mound> A reinforcable structure that can be used to resist sandstorms; Dirt Mounds are naturally more durable in this environment and have higher HP

ccStages.name: Abandoned Plot
ccStages.description: An Ursus Drone Reconnaissance Squad disguised as Guerrillas remains on standby deep within the ruins of Chernobog. No matter what they are waiting for, it's time to hand them their eviction notices.

ccStages.name: Hui-ch'i Foothills
ccStages.description:
Dusk has departed Mount Hui-ch'i, yet the creatures born from her brushstrokes still remain, and it may take a bit of work to get this thick ink to fade.
<Mark of Hui and Ming> Operators deployed on it will earn a Hui-Ming attribute
<Mark of Dusk and Dawn> On first passing through, enemies will change attribute
<Two-Step Firecracker mk2> Deals Arts damage to enemies in the four adjacent tiles, changing Hui-Ming attributes within its range

ccStages.name: Blazing Cavern
ccStages.description:
Inside a cavern not far from a volcano, a band of thugs have seemingly tamed a massive Infected Creature. You must keep it from rampaging across the wilderness. Stop the thugs before they leave the cavern.
<Lava Crack> Spray out lava periodically, dealing massive damage to friendly units on the surrounding 8 tiles and melting down Roadblocks

ccStages.name: Grand Knight Territory Bar District
ccStages.description:
Late-night Kazimierz sees drunken knights wandering all over, but outnumbering them are the Armorless Union hidden in the shadows... and certain fanatical imitators of the knights.
<City Neon> Provides an initial amount of visibility, and can further increase visibility when used
<Knight Crest> When used, permanently provides visibility over a certain tile

ccStages.name: Sandsea Remnants
ccStages.description:
A wealth of secrets are hidden in Sargon's deserts, and it's not just the local lords ameer who want their hands on them.
<Mobile Tactical Hangar> Deploys drones as needed to assist enemy combatants.

ccStages.name: Sal Viento Karst
ccStages.description: The fall of Quintus has not stopped Seaborn activity in the area. Find and eliminate them.

ccStages.name: Shangshu Trails
ccStages.description: The treacherous Shangshu Trails are haunted by Waregeists and Ink Spirits. Are they seeking their absent masters, or a freedom that they do not understand?

ccStages.name: Londinium Outskirts
ccStages.description:
The Sarkaz have become the masters of Londinium. Protect the workers who built the city from their oppression.
<Londinium Secondary Defense Artillery> Once fully charged, deals area True damage to both allies and enemies, centered on the friendly unit with the highest Block.

ccStages.name: County Hillock Depot
ccStages.description:
They are the ghosts of a bygone era. Their hatred and fury haunt the outskirts of the rebuilding city.
<Tattered Pillar> Can be knocked down by neighboring Operators, dealing True damage to the two tiles it falls on and forming rubble that blocks routes.

ccStages.name: Under-Construction Beachside
ccStages.description:
Lady Candela has carved out a corner of Dossoles's artificial beach to allow the newly-arriving Durin architects to show off their talents, but when these "geniuses" get sloshed with the local workers and start making a scene, someone needs to teach them a lesson.
<Deep Water Zone> Unable to deploy on these tiles. Enemies on these tiles have reduced ASPD and Movement Speed, and continually lose HP
<Custom Floating Platform> Can be deployed on Deep Water Zones, thereafter any unit can be deployed on that tile. The platform is destroyed when the deployed unit retreats.

ccStages.name: Tundra Mines
ccStages.description:
The desolate conditions of Ursus's tundra mines have forced the miners to flee simply to survive. Under conditions of anonymity, a Rhodes Island detachment was given authorization to rescue these miners and provide a means of escape.
<Static Roadblock> Blocks the movement of Ursus Civilians and Talulah, the Fighter; Can be destroyed by your units.
<Ursus Civilian> Life Points will be deducted by 1 when killed by an enemy.
